E. Sutherland. Proceedings of the Spring Joint Computer Conference , 329-346, 1963. Displaying images Foley et al., Sections 4.3.1, 4.4.1, 13 (especially 13.1.1, 13.2 (intro), 13.2.1, 13.3.1), 5.4 Optional: K. Sims. Artificial evolution for computer graphics. Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH '91) 25(4), 319-328. Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH '92) 26(2), 35-42. Texture and reflection in computer generated images. Texture mapping as a fundamental drawing primitive. Image compositing Foley et al., Section 17.6 Thomas Porter and Tom Duff. Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH '84) 18(3), 253-259. Optional: Neider, Davis & Woo, Chapter 7 Line drawing Foley et al., Sections 3.2, 3.17 Optional: Foley et l., Section 14.10 Robert F. Sproull. Polygon scan conversion Foley et al., Sections 3.5, 3.6, 19.2.8 Curves Foley et al., Sections 11(intro), 11.1.1, 11.2 Surfaces Foley et al., Section 11.3 Hidden surface algorithms Foley et al., Chapter 15 Optional: I. E. Sutherland, R. F. Sproull, and R. A. Schumacker, A characterization of ten hidden surface algorithms, ACM Computing Surveys 6(1): 1-55, March 1974. Ray tracing Foley et al., Sections 16.11, 16.12 Optional: T. Whitted. An improved illumination model for shaded display. Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH 89) 23(3): 281-288. Rendering tricks Foley et al., Sections 16.3, 16.4, 16.6, 16.12.1 Optional: William T. Reeves, David H. Salesin, and Robert L. Cook.
